result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

chargeModifiers.descr: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alendia Latrice Beamon

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed.

Defendant Alendia Latrice Beamon in court.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court for Alendia Latrice Beamon.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Scheduling conference held. Defense is requesting a plea and sentencing date. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Received and Filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Previous no contact order with CLB is continued by the court.

Defendant Alendia Latrice Beamon appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent appeared by video for Alendia Latrice Beamon.  Attorney Michael J. Odden appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13.
Scheduling conference scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($1,000.00 signature bond) LW
signed and filed
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO COMMISSIONER. Court further orders that bail is forfeited.
Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.
from CB, Received and Filed.

Defendant Alendia Latrice Beamon in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Alendia Latrice Beamon appeared by video means with Attorney.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.   All parties are advised effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to a Branch of RESERVE JUDGES.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Alendia Latrice Beamon in court with attorney Matthew V Plummer.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom and live streamed through DA Cast.  Case recalled.  Defendant appeared.  Court ordered the bench warrant withdrawn.  Atty. Plummer has received discovery and an offer and requests time to review it with his client.  Case is adjourned to Br. 37.  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/3c595ccd-39e3-09d4-8db1-82162d766d4f  Status conference scheduled for June 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

10:05 AM Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court.  
Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  Case set for pretrial conference.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued forthwith. COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT. Court takes no action as to bail.
received and filed

Court ordered no contact with CLB
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Alendia Latrice Beamon in court with attorney Kylie Kaltenberg.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
